p: In our models, the precipitation of the driest quarter and soil class were the two variables that exerted the largest influence on the distribution of dry forest tree species. Precipitation during the dry season has been suggested as the most critical element for determining vegetation patterns [ 64] because water remains a critical factor driving basic physiological processes of tropical trees [ 65]. Conversely, soil characteristics differentiate seasonally dry forests from savannas, even under similar climate regimes [ 66] and have been shown to affect the vegetation structure in Northern Peruvian dry forests [ 67]. In the context of major environmental processes, our study region represents typical characteristics for tropical dry forests.
